Articles.Content:
Exactly. I read your mind, you're obviously wondering what happened if you are reading this. Well, you want to know?

Well, then. I made a mod part, did all of that crap with Unity and Blender, made an edit of a stock part.cfg file for it, blah, blah, blah. Everything worked well.

Except...when in the VAB...the engine is...uh...sideways...?

I know, WAT!

Is there a way I can edit the .cfg file so it rotates the model 90 degrees on a certain vector I specify?

If it matters that much, I edited the Skipper engine's .cfg. I will try some other .cfg's. Please tell me what you think.
No, just re-export the model with the correct rotation.
